line_2: All is the sport of Death; the change I fear;

line_1: The low-hanging vapours and clouds disappear,
line_2: Repeating her promise .... " In May I'll be here."

line_1: Just bloom and charm, then fade and disappear?
line_2: YOung, fair, and good! ah why should young and fair
And now two bloody swords are there.

line_1: Would vanish soon, and quickly disappear,
line_2: Were you, like us, encumber'd thus with Care.
And all the charms of a Sicilian year.

line_1: And all thy ghastly train of terrors disappear.
line_2: When his resounding, awful voice they hear,

line_1: But soon the melting beauties disappear,
line_2: These tints of sadness, and these shades of fear,
When the approaching Form comes near.

line_1: I call'd thy beauty forth, I bid it disappear.
line_2: But now, curst woman, thy last sentence hear:
How fade the glories of the year!
Wasting in the sea of air,

line_1: I've been gaz'd at enough, 'tis time to disappear.
line_2: I'll move no longer in this gaudy Sphear,
